abstract: Home Depot‘s recently ousted chief executive, Robert Nardelli, has received a job offer from Cerberus Capital Management, CNBC reported, citing undisclosed sources. But the home-improvement retailer may try to prevent him from joining Cerberus, a private equity firm whose investments include tje General Motors Acceptance Corporation and the parent of Air Canada, by invoking his noncompete contract, CNBC said.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot‘s recently ousted chief executive, Robert Nardelli, has received a job offer from Cerberus Capital Management, CNBC reported, citing undisclosed sources. But the home-improvement retailer may try to prevent him from joining Cerberus, a private equity firm whose investments include tje General Motors Acceptance Corporation and the parent of Air Canada, by invoking his noncompete contract, CNBC said.

headline.main: Cerberus Said to Offer Job to Home Depot Ex-Chief
